thread.title: Portland's historic year for gang violence, visualized
thread.title_full: Portland's historic year for gang violence, visualized | OregonLive.com

author: Steve Suo | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Portland's historic year for gang violence, visualized
text:
Portland's police gang enforcers rolled out 146 calls through early October, more than in any full year since the city started counting, in 1998.
Just the two weeks ended Oct. 9 brought 13 cases of gunfire that police attributed to gang activity. These included a double homicide outside the Hour Glass Pub & Eatery in Northeast Portland's Montavilla neighborhood, and a homicide at the Pallas strip club on Southeast Powell Boulevard.
At least two more shootings have unfolded since then, bringing the 2015 tally to 148 so far.
What do we know about the trends behind this big increase?
The Oregonian/OregonLive's Everton Bailey worked with visual media artist Mark Graves to produce a video animation of the data behind the violence.
We know from this, for example, that May was the biggest burst of gang calls , and that nighttime is when most gunplay breaks out.
We'll continue to track gang team calls on our interactive map through the rest of the year. Data are typically updated every two weeks.
Videos and maps can give you the lay of the land.
